references.paper_title: Fully-convolutional Siamese networks for object tracking
references.reason: This paper is foundational to Siamese network-based trackers, a core concept in visual object tracking, and heavily referenced in DeTrack's related work.

references.paper_title: Learning discriminative model prediction for tracking
references.reason: This paper introduces a discriminative model prediction approach that influences DeTrack's design of a denoising learning paradigm for visual object tracking.

references.paper_title: ATOM: Accurate tracking by overlap maximization
references.reason: This highly influential paper proposes ATOM, a widely used and highly effective visual object tracker, and DeTrack improves on its methodology in several aspects.
This paper introduces the Denoising Diffusion Probabilistic Model (DDPM), a core concept inspiring DeTrack's denoising learning paradigm for enhanced robustness.

references.paper_title: Extracting and composing robust features with denoising autoencoders
references.reason: This foundational paper on denoising autoencoders (DAE) provides the theoretical basis for DeTrack's in-model latent denoising learning, improving model robustness to unseen data.
